[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenHolder/TokenHolderContract_ACS1_TransactionFeeProvider.cs] [Function: SetMethodFee()] [DoS Attack] Can an attacker create input.Fees with extremely large number of entries causing the foreach loop to consume excessive gas and revert legitimate fee updates? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenHolder/TokenHolderContract_ACS1_TransactionFeeProvider.cs] [Function: SetMethodFee()] [Race Condition] If two transactions call SetMethodFee() with same MethodName simultaneously, can the second transaction overwrite the first without any merge logic, causing fee configuration loss? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenHolder/TokenHolderContract_ACS1_TransactionFeeProvider.cs] [Function: SetMethodFee()] [Authorization Timing] Between RequiredMethodFeeControllerSet() at line 14 and authorization check at line 16, can State.MethodFeeController.Value be modified by another transaction, causing TOCTOU vulnerability?
